CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1957, pg. 24, reads: "Courier Hosts Newsboys at Annual Picnic - Outing For Newsies - Nearly 200 newsboys and girls spent the entire day at South Park's Sully's Pool and Grove as guests of The Pittsburgh Courier at the annual Newsboys Picnic on Aug. 30. The picnic, a circulation-promotion project, under the supervision of A.D. (Jake) Gaither, circulation manager; William Clyde Page, promotion manager, and William G. Nunn Sr., coordinator, was acclaimed a huge success.  Assisting the aforementioned were Leroy Randalll [Randall], Carl Davis, Lloyd Tobias, and Donald Williams, distributors, who were mainly responsible for the large turnout.  James D. Drake, promotion art director, acted as co-chairman of the program activities, along with Mr. Davis.  Others who volunteered their services as attendants were Mrs. Bernice Price, Mrs. Lloyd Tobias, Miss Valerie Stewart and Minister Robert X. Davenport of Muhammad Temple of Islam No. 24.  Plenty of good food, baseball, volleyball, and football games, assorted foot races, swimming and rock and roll music kept the newsboys and girls busy throughout the day...Three large Pittsburgh Railways buses transported the newsboys and girls to and from the park. - Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Girl, and boys gathered around barbecue pit with large pot full of hot dogs during Pittsburgh Courier newsboys picnic, South Park
